poem:
**Meditations on Morning News**

A cup of coffee cools,  
headlines fold like reluctant wings.  
A medic's name is not mentioned,  
just a note, a single strike  
in a ledger of distance and debris.  
Outside, the sky carries on  
its ancient blue agreements  
while the ground shifts below unnoticed,  
a globe of small, unreachable hands.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Medics killed and wounded in Israeli attack on Gaza hospital A medic has been killed in an Israeli missile strike on a hospital in Gaza, just as Israeli prime minister Benjamin Netanyahu was making a visit to the war-torn territory. The attack on Tuesday came two days after another major hospital was targeted, fuelling warnings from the UN that the humanitarian crisis in Gaza is now the worst it has been since conflict began. According". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
